website_summaries.verdict: This clever product is a popular model. Like all products for young children, it must be used with supervision and care.
pros: Thickly cushioned, contoured seat attached to stool
Seat doesn't slide, giving a secure feeling
Easy assembly with no tools required
Fits standard and most elongated toilet seats
cons: More than one parent reported the stool slipped with a child on it, causing injury
To avoid this, follow safety precautions and do not leave out where child could use unsupervised

customer_reviews.title: Instability caused tooth trauma in my 2 year old
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this, but it has been rather problematic. It's extremely unstable and has zero mechanism to keep it from sliding off the toilet. My potty training two year old climbed up and was turning around to seat himself (while supervised) and the seat slipped off the toilet. He fell and hit his front teeth on the toilet and one of the front teeth has to be removed from the trauma. I would highly recommend finding a seat that won't slide around so much on the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Marianna

customer_reviews.title: Not safe
customer_reviews.text: This thing is seriously flimsy. My toddler was climbing up it and as she was turning to sit it flipped and she fell and hit the vanity. No blood but decent bruising. Not a safe product. Better off with a wide stool and a simple potty seat.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Miceli

customer_reviews.title: What I do not like about the seat for a little boy is that ...
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old loves to put this seat onto and take it off the toilet. He makes sure to put his feet where they are marked on the step. It fits well with the toilet seat down. What I do not like about the seat for a little boy is that the guard pictured on the front of the seat is not at all as it appears. I have ordered 2 of these and neither guard is as pictured. Over all it is a good seat but unless your boy is able to keep his penis pointed down (good luck) I'd look for another seat or invest in Clorox cleaning wipes to keep handy for clean up.
customer_reviews.author: DParker

customer_reviews.title: The seat is NOT the same as described for this ...
customer_reviews.text: The seat is NOT the same as described for this listing. The described and pictured has front and back padding (for proper placement and protection), the one in the box- is flat. Those who has boys they know WHAT will it be with baby peeing on flat seat..where will it all go. I wonder if is the same error for all orders or just a random mistake...
customer_reviews.author: Marina Poplavskaya Guedouar

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed.
customer_reviews.text: We still have the training seat on the upstairs toilet with a separate stool but my toddler feels like she's going to slip so someone has to be there for support. With this, she goes to the toilet by herself and she loves having somewhere to put her feet. This was a desperation purchase but it worked better than I even hoped it could! ***Update*** well after potty training was completed, this is still used. Over a year now and no problems at all. However, the best part, unlike other styles of potty training seats, this one doesn't get disgusting or trap urine between the padded seat and the handle. Definitely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: dpino

customer_reviews.title: Not safe and gross
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a great idea but poor quality and design. The seat moves around with nothing to secure as the kid climbs. Worst party of all...its plasticky fabric on the back of the seat as pictured so it got gross after a few uses. The pee spots stain doesn't come off with Clorox wipe and bleach!!!. Not sanitatary and unsafe product. Wouldn't recommend it to any child. Horrible. Waste of time and money. If you are gonna put a product on the market wouldn't you think to at least have safety and sanitary standards met? Geez
customer_reviews.author: Bubu

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: Our son would NOT poop in the potty until we got this seat. He has to feel secure and those little potty seats that go on top didn’t cut it. First, we tried a foldable potty seat and it pinched his legs. Then we tried the padded kind that sits on top and has handles. It was fine, but he couldn’t easily climb up on it himself. This helped him get up on the potty independently and also use the bathroom comfortably and securely. The best part is that the legs do not slide on the floor, so it’s a sturdy climb up. Great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Fine for us
customer_reviews.text: We have had one since May 2015. It is starting to get gross because urine gets trapped in the seat seams and on the little things that keep it in place on the toilet, so I'm buying a new one for my soon to be potty training 3 year old. We've never had a problem with it. When purchased with a little plastic urinal, way better than cleaning and dumping a gross little floor potty.
customer_reviews.author: Wyoming477475858483

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Yes it's a tad flimsy but if used with supervision and correct handling then it works great. Make sure your child doesn't jump on and off it, make sure they use both handles and get on and off slowly. We've never had an issue. The handles/sides will come off if you pull them apart so its important to tell your child to be careful when using it. Love the cushioned seats although the "built in splash guard" could be better. My 3 year old can put this on the toilet herself.
customer_reviews.author: jenerationmama

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy, poor design
customer_reviews.text: Worst contraption ever. There is nothing to keep the step from flying up into your toddlers face. I got this for my son to help him get up and he refuses to use it because when he sits on the seat he also holds the handles and then they fly up into his face. This makes him feel insecure and as if he will fall off the toilet. Not helpful when you are trying to potty train and actually caused us to take some steps backwards. Do not buy this product. You would be better off with a plastic step stool and a little potty seat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Angry rash
customer_reviews.text: I am torn on the rating! My daughter used this seat with success. She feels independent and likes how he feet aren't dangling. Problem is that it caused a horrible contact rash on her butt cheeks. It was painful and looked horrible. We have to throw it out. Now she asks where her "steps" went! I clean it daily with water then baby wipes (no chemicals) but the rash is only getting worse. Now I'm looking for something else. Potty training is hard!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Good seat. Make sure it comes with all the parts.
customer_reviews.text: Great. My 2.5 year old has been using it since just before she turned two for potty training. Decided we needed one for downstairs, too. Took off a star because the second one we ordered didn’t have the clips to hold the potty seat to the sides of the ladder. Unfortunately my husband threw away the box before we realized this. So now we have to order another one. Kind of aggravating.
customer_reviews.author: Ouisa

customer_reviews.title: However for little boys it is not great. As previously mentioned the shield is not very ...
customer_reviews.text: Yes it works. My little boy can climb up, sit down, and go potty. However for little boys it is not great. As previously mentioned the shield is not very tall and he tends to pee on it. In addition to this, there is a seam on the inside of the seat that collects urine and it then puddles under the seat, meaning lots of clean up for mom and dad. He likes it though so we will keep using it, makes him more confident to have have handles to hold on to get get on and off. Fits our elongated extra tall toilet fine, giving three starts because seat design could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Lanette

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This is the most unstable potty seat ever. When my 3 year old climbs on it it slips a little and shakes under her weight. She’s 32 pounds. She acts nervous climbing up on it and I feel anxious watching her. It’s awkward, flimsy, and just a piece of crap. Wish I read more reviews before I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: SarahJoy

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: Worth the price!!! This is the third one I buy, my son is now 4 and he's been using it for a little over 2 yrs now. He has one at home and one at the sitters, bought the third as a gift for a babay cousin who is in need to start potty training. The handle takes away the fear of falling, gives them something to grab onto while doing their busisness. And the seat is very comfortable, a nice cushion, and it's all easy to clean! I'd buy this as many times as needed!!
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Aldama

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and works great
customer_reviews.text: This works really well in our kids bathroom, our toddler is able to use the bathroom herself which is great. Our 2.5 yr old hasn't mastered pulling her pants down and getting up the ladder, she takes everything off unless we help her. The seat lays on top of the toilet and doesn't secure down so it is easy to remove and it folds up if you needed it for a bathroom that is shared with adults. The only down size is cleaning it because it has a a seam on the seat part that things get stuck in so it needs to be cleaned really well after poops. Way easier than cleaning one of those floor potties!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Dunn

customer_reviews.title: My little boy will not use it.
customer_reviews.text: I gave it to stars because it was made well. So far all it has done is take up room. My little boy prefers a $3 step stool that I have next to the big potty. Would not buy it again would not recommend it. If a little boy sits down and he has to go pee it's going to go everywhere unless he's lean all the way forward. May work for little a girl but it is not designed for well for young boys. Also looking at it I do not believe my daughters would have used it either. So please look for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Robbert S.

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: We have three of these now, one at grandma's, one at home and one in kindergarten. My daughter is very petite and was not using the bathroom at school because she was afraid she was going to fall in (she would have). These allow her to feel save and secure plus it easy enough to move it when someone else needs the facilities.
customer_reviews.author: Margey

customer_reviews.title: Fits most toilets and makes it easier for child to get on the toilet.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and durable, we got this for our toddler who is potty training. The seat is cushioned and fits our toilets perfectly!! The only complaint I'd have about this, is that the foot stool and bottom part can come up if unbalanced, making it wobbly. That can cause a little difficulty for a child who isn't very good with balance. We put a small foot stool at the end of it and that loved the problem and our toddler was able to climb up and down as needed. I would still reccomend this product though!
customer_reviews.author: VICTORIA LAMB

customer_reviews.title: The only thing I don't like is that it doesn't lock into position
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my two year old because she was trying to dump her own potty chair and that was a big mess. This seat fits perfectly on our toilet. The only thing I don't like is that it doesn't lock into position. My daughter sits there and swings the foot rest part up and down and then gets her feet caught behind it. She also says that it hurts her legs if she moves around on the seat too much. I think the plastic seam might rub on her because if she's sitting still she doesn't complain at all. Overall I think this is a great product and I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old (just turned 2) can use this all by herself which is amazing since I’m currently breastfeeding a fussy newborn also. It’s pretty secure, (as opposed to a step stool and separate potty seat which slides around when she climbs on and has no handles). Would highly recommend if you want to encourage independence without having to trust your toddler to empty the little potty full of pee and poop into the big potty 😬🤦🏼‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Amazon buyer

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: Huge help for potty training! My 2 yr old loves it and quickly figured out how to maneuver getting it on and off by herself. Folds nicely to fit between potty and wall. Lasts longer than I thought. It seemed flimsy at first, but this kid is hard on stuff and this ladder has survived! Love that the seat is cushioned too, she loves it and says that it "gets warm" unlike her little potty lol. Overall, has helped promote independence and got her motivated to use the potty since she can do it herself.
customer_reviews.author: B. Boelt

customer_reviews.title: super simple and great for starter potty
customer_reviews.text: We previously ordered another one due to good reviews, but the opening was wayyy too big for little toddlers. This one has a great size of an opening for little toddlers to start potting training without the fear of falling through. My kids doesn't mind it. Loves that it folds up easily, has cushioned seats, and is sturdy for kids to go up and down on it. Definitely Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly. Pee spills over seat.
customer_reviews.text: I had read so many reviews of various models before very carefully purchasing this and I’m disappointed. It is flimsy and wobbly. Somehow pee either spills over the seat or gets trapped under it. My daughter went back to using the potty after a few days of this so I quickly packed it up and went back to a child toilet seat insert with step stool.
customer_reviews.author: Kx

customer_reviews.title: it was easy to put together and I love that it folds ...
customer_reviews.text: The seat itself works well, it was easy to put together and I love that it folds up when she isn't using it. My only complaint is that it is a little wobbly and moves easily on the floor when my daughter tries to climb up on the seat. This alone makes her a little uneasy starting out potty-training, as when she steps on the stool, it slides a little along the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan C

customer_reviews.title: Would fit a round toilet better then our oblong toilet
customer_reviews.text: Would fit a round toilet better then our oblong toilet. Also, measure the height of your toilet ours is a bit higher so stepping up to get onto the toilet is not as secure for my granddaughter...wobbly.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Szatkowski

customer_reviews.title: Adventurous kid likes to jump off the stair, but still a totally great product
customer_reviews.text: Our kid did manage to fall off this at the beginning, but he is prone to taking advantage of the tempting stair to jump off onto the floor. The fall was a tiny bit annoying, but the convenience of the little stair has been totally worth it to make our kid more independent.
customer_reviews.author: Shaunna

customer_reviews.title: i HATE this potty
customer_reviews.text: I hate this seat with a passion. Would give it 1 star except that it may work better if your toddler is a girl. However, if your child is endowed with a nozzle, the flat bottom of this seat does NOTHING to keep piss from spraying everywhere. Seeping out the front AND back of the seat, leaking or outright spraying onto his underwear, pants, and the floor. I have to wipe everything--potty seat, toilet seat, floor--every time he uses it, and still over time my bathroom has come to smell like baby piss. Because droplets go where you don't know about. Also, it's not that sturdy, so does require supervision.
customer_reviews.author: e

customer_reviews.title: Too wobbly
customer_reviews.text: Was excited about this, but unfortunately it is just not going to work. It is very unsteady and wobbly, which is not what I expected. It is a falling hazard for my child, and I will be sending it back because it is too unsafe. That being said, it might be because of the toilets we have - they are a bit longer than standard seats (our toilet lids are too long for standard toilet seat covers). Disappointed, as I was looking toward to using this for potty training.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Not as stable as I'd hope, cumbersome for toddler to put in place
customer_reviews.text: Great product, does not give the independence my child craves. My daughter lacks the upper body strength/coordination to put this up herself while needing to pee. We try to leave it up all the time. Not as stabile as I would have hoped. There is some movement when the child sits or is positioning themselves on the seat. It makes them visibly nervous. I do not think I will use this with the second kid. a floor potty gives the kid complete freedom to go when they need without any extra steps or fear of falling. I think a squatty potty step stool with a incorporated kid's lid is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Angela B

customer_reviews.title: If your potty training make sure your son or daughter can use steps.
customer_reviews.text: My son had trouble getting to the toilet because it was to talk. The steps were are great help to my son independently go to the bathroom.when family is over it is easy to fold and put in the corner. I had my husband assemble and he put it together in 5 minutes. Soon my daughter will use the steps. My son loves the patted seat.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: and they're just the worst. So much rinsing and cleaning
customer_reviews.text: We spent a long time dealing with the little potties, and they're just the worst. So much rinsing and cleaning, and they're all designed to somehow collect a weird type of bathroom-exclusive dust and always look gross. I wish we could've used the Mommy's Helper earlier, but our little didn't have long enough legs, which is the reason for the four star review. If it had an additional step, it would definitely earn an extra star. It is tricky to clean, but that just seems integral to the design and I don't see how it could be helped. It gave our toddler so much potty independence and overall improved the finalization of potty-training.
customer_reviews.author: Jade B

customer_reviews.title: Nice option for potty training on full sized toilets
customer_reviews.text: Oh the joys of toilet training. We decided to buy an adapter for our toilets rather than buy little training pottys. Researched around and this product seemed to fit what we wanted - easy to put on and take off, handles, a step. Thus far, it's worked out for the most part. It's sturdy enough given the lightweight construction. I think the only issue we have is that our girls like to lift up the step and floor brace while they're sitting on the seat defying our wishes for poopie on the potty :) I'd definitely recommend this for parents who are potty training that don't want to deal with cleaning and maintaining separate stand alone little potty seats.
customer_reviews.author: d808Top Contributor: Pokémon

customer_reviews.title: Best potty helper I have seen
customer_reviews.text: For potty training this has been a saviour. Our daughter always wanted to use the "big girl potty" that the rest of us use so the little one we got her doesn't work for her. She wants to be like everyone else. This is perfect for that. No chance for her to fall in "shes 2" it fits her butt perfectly. She can get up and down by herself. This is a must for potty training!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lance Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Great Potty Option for Toddlers
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered a second for our upstairs bathroom. We've tried the little potty, and the separate stepping stool/potty seat combination, but this is the one our toddler feels most confident using. She usually puts it on the toilet herself if it's off to the side. She can climb up and adjust her eight to be comfortable. We have oval shaped toilet seats and this fits great - very sturdy. We've had ours for 5 months and everything appears to be working and intact. I don't want to jinx anything, but I feel good saying that this has made potty training easier for us.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi B.

customer_reviews.title: This is no safe!
customer_reviews.text: This is very unstable, and the anti slip pads do not work, they do not prevent slipping. Step up area wobbled excessively when our 3 year old toddler stepped up on it while holding handles, which didn’t feel secure at all, it scared him to death and he refused to use it.
customer_reviews.author: B.E. Shaia

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. I had high expectation considering this item has ...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I had high expectation considering this item has over 2000 reviews plus it includes all the features i was looking for: stairs with handles to help the toddler getting on the toilet and a cushion seat. But the stair is too thin and cannot be stablized. The cushion seat doesnt lock on the toilet that it kept moving around when my son sit on it. When my son sits on it, he kept moving up and down the handles/stairs. Quite annoy and such distraction when we try to potty train him. I ended up returning this.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Not long after she asked to actually try like Mommy & Daddy
customer_reviews.text: This product is what initiated our toddler's interest in potty training. At first she just wanted to climb the steps and sit on it. Then she would pretend to go pee pee in the potty while fully clothed. Not long after she asked to actually try like Mommy & Daddy, which was quickly followed by successful peeing in the potty. This helped her get over her fear of sitting on the big toilet out in public too. She loves holding onto the handles. Easily wiped clean and easily assembled (be sure you read the instructions and you should not have problems). Folds very slim for storage and easy to take with us for overnights away from home. Highly recommended product!
customer_reviews.author: GinaR

customer_reviews.title: It didn't fit our toilet, so had to return the item.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the item, because the seat wouldn't fit securely over our toilet seat in the house. Because of this the step was able to move around which made it more of a safety hazard than a convenience. So I had to return it. Good idea otherwise, so please check the fitting of your seat to see if it's compatible. Luckily Amazon allows me to return the item with no hassle.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: A little awkward to use, but it does help.
customer_reviews.text: My 2 y.o. boy can use this with assistance. The process can be awkward at times because the front lip of the seat is very wide. He has to scoot pretty far back on the seat to avoid firehosing the seat, little steps, floor, and opposite wall. The effort required to scoot back far enough can be a little daunting for him. Once he's on the seat, he likes to swivel the steps up and down. Not sure how I feel about this... He's definitely entertained, but not too focused on the task at hand.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer P.

customer_reviews.title: these are great, we have twins and an upstairs and downstairs ...
customer_reviews.text: these are great, we have twins and an upstairs and downstairs so we got two and the girls like them a lot, they're easy enough to use and maneuver that the kids (2 yrs) can get them out if one of us has to use the big potty and forgets to put it back, love it, would highly recommend. the only thing i don't like, but is not a problem with the product, is that if the pee pee stream hits the edge of the padded seat and you don't realize it, the pee pee can go under the seat and kinda just sit there on top of the toilet seat, gross!
customer_reviews.author: Denise Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit
customer_reviews.text: Liked the idea but it didn't fit my standard toilet and it was wobbly. My husband adjusted the inner pegs that keep the seat from sliding but the wobbling made me toddler uneasy. Ended up buying a stool and toddler/adult combo toilet seat.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis's gal

customer_reviews.title: Very messy for boys - too many grooves.
customer_reviews.text: It works well enough but it is really messy for boys. So far, it is stable enough for an older toddler in an elongated toilet. It was easy to put together and works as described. However, it has a lot of grooves and nooks that get soaked with boys. And they are too narrow to wipe, so you have to put water with pressure to get out the mess - too much work.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, do not let kid use it alone, not enough grip and they can slip.
customer_reviews.text: Overall it was easy to assemble and it fits over normal toilet seat. Only downside was the grip between the legs and the ground. When telling my son to use the step he was able to move the entire system by simply pivoting on the step.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Slight Safety Hazard to be aware of.....
customer_reviews.text: There are two small holes near the top that my 2 year old child puts her fingers into. They then get stuck and she screams for me because she tries to yank them out at a weird angle. I’ve had to place tape over said holes because she did this on two separate occasions. It’s difficult to explain, but a product designed for young children should not have small holes that entice them to stick their tiny fingers in..when they have nothing better to do while using the restroom. The product is alright, not great quality...but does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Stable and safe
customer_reviews.text: I had one of the seat rings that required a step stool and shifted occasionally when my granddaughter used it. This has non skid feet and stays in place while they climb up and down. The handles on the top gives my granddaughter something 'clean' to hold onto while she climbs up or down. The step eliminated the need for a stool to climb up. It folds and fits into a closet for storage. A must for every grandma!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this for months and don't know where we'd be without it. It doesn't wiggle and move around like other child seats. We have had another seat just like this one for years. It gets used so much we decided to get one for a second bathroom. Our child has been using it independently since she started potty training. It's easy for a child to put it in place and take it off again to store elsewhere. The quality is great and it's very easy to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: mrs goz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for a child that needs to do everything on ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for a child that needs to do everything on their own. We didn't want to store a bulky step stool in our bathroom. This folds up and fits next to our toilet. My 2.5 year old daughter can put the toilet seat on herself and has no issues climbing it herself. I read reviews saying they felt this was flimsy and was a little concerned but bought it anyway. So glad we did. I don't feel it is flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Gamble

customer_reviews.title: No deflector- what planet are these people from?
customer_reviews.text: This seat has no deflector. Love everything about it except it's only suitable for little girls. I really wanted to make this work since it's alleviated my toddlers fear of the big potty but now we're both covered in pee after each time using it. Don't know what planet these people are from who manufactured this; to even call such subtle molding a 'deflector' is not accurate or truthful. It's more like a speed bump for the pee that's firing in your direction. Either don't bother with this seat, or get a poncho, yo.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa84

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My son refused to use the separate little potty so we tried this. It’s still in use 2 years later. If kids don’t pay attention or rush then it can slip but we haven’t had any issues at all. The seat cushion could be a little softer.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Rickety but can probably be made workable with some effort
customer_reviews.text: As mentioned in other reviews, this thing is rickety. My two year old seems somewhat frightened by it. So he is on a potty chair for the time being. I'm hoping to add some non-skid pads underneath the seat (so it doesn't slide around) and the legs (because these have a chintzy design--they should be completely flat on the bottom, like a step ladder, but they are rounded) and get him to use this to transition to the big potty once he has the training nailed.
customer_reviews.author: Anna M.

customer_reviews.title: Safe and comfy seat for little ones!
customer_reviews.text: This seat is the best! I wish we hadn't wasted our time and money on other seats before learning about this kind. I love that the seat is soft and that it has a step for my little one to climb up on her own! We had one that was just a plastic seat and it hurt my little ones bum, then me had a cushioned seat but it would slide around when she tried to get up on her own. This is way safer!
customer_reviews.author: New mom

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, bad design
customer_reviews.text: I like the fold up design, cushion seat, and safety handles on the Mommy's Helper toilet seat, the actual seat does not allow my toddler to sit far back enough to properly pee into the toilet without making a mess. Maybe if the ladder was connected farther back on the seat she would be able to scoot back far enough. Otherwise, it was easy to put together and folds away nicely when not in use. However, she doesn't use this seat often because she can't use it by herself without peeing down the front of the seat.
customer_reviews.author: SterlingMom

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect! It's easy for you to use and even my 2 year old knows how to use it. My son wouldn't go in a chair that wasn't over the toilet. He wanted to go the bathroom in the same place we did, so we got this and now he wants to go in the toilet. It makes the transition of potty chair to toilet really easy cause he already goes in the toilet. The only thing I can think of, is sometimes when he pees as he sits it will start to go between the to seats. All I have to do is position him back farther.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica S.

customer_reviews.title: Good for road trips
customer_reviews.text: We mainly use this seat when go on road trips for hotel room potties. Ultimately, I do like this potty chair & it fits our toilet well and is comfortable for my son to sit on for longer sittings. You do have to move it a bit forward for elongated toilets so that the pee goes in the toilet whether your boy is pointing down or not. Also, it could be a bit sturdier for bigger children - my son is 4 years old and in the 99th percentile for height & weight, so I help him get on and off because it would not be stable enough if he did it alone.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna A.

customer_reviews.title: Potty chair that makes kids want to use the toilet!
customer_reviews.text: I love this potty seat. It is easy for little ones to put on the toilet their self and it allows them to feel safe from falling in the toilet. It's really nice with the place for there feet too. My son started using the toilet the same day I got this toilet seat. He loves it and isn't scared anymore. So if your child is scared like mine this is the toilet seat for you. So I would recommend this to any parent that's potty training. It was a little work putting together but so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Light weight! 2 year old boy/girl twins love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: We love this thing! Both my two year olds know how to or this on the potty and climb up and do their thing! It’s got a nice coushion to sit on and our twins are boy and girl and neither have issues with splashing over or under or anything! The oringinal assembly was kinda difficult but eventually I figured it out!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great idea. Terribly unstable
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a brilliant idea and was so excited to use it. But when I got it and built it, it was so shakey, I wouldn't let my son go up and down in his own because of fear it would collapse and plus. He was really uneasy going up and down on his own. Also the buttons to connect The seat to the ladder was so cheap, like a clothes pin, it would pop off the minute you open and close it to store it. We never used it and it was a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: raterrater

customer_reviews.title: Easy for every day use
customer_reviews.text: Since getting this seat and practicing sitting on it, our toddler decided one day she'd start using the potty and hasn't gone back since. We previously tried one of those plastic potties but she didn't like that. In day care the other kids used a real potty so this was more enticing. The cushioned seat is easy to clean and grip on to. Taking it off and positioning it back is a breeze, even she can do it herself. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: S. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Do Not recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Design and idea is great... but putting it into use it’s very unstable. Maybe our toilet shape is just not compatible but it wiggles a lot when my daughter tries to sit on it. The stepstool doesn’t support her petite 33lbs Toddler body. I wish I used the money and invested into another seat. Now we will just try to make the best of it but if it doesn’t work I will have to suck it up and buy another brand maybe.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie W.

customer_reviews.title: Your toilet will thank you!
customer_reviews.text: Ahh potty training. That wonderful part of life that every parent looks forward to. My son was late to the potty training game and after purchasing about a half dozen other toilet seats in varying flavors, I finally found this. He can put it on the seat easily himself and the handles give him comfort so he's not left dangling or holding onto the side of the seat. Great little device that's made our adventure so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Jasey

customer_reviews.title: Better For Potty Training
customer_reviews.text: It was really hard to put together, and should have been wayyyyy easier to assemble. But once done with this (it took me an hour, however...and usually this kind of thing is easy for me, but they made it way too confusing) it went to the bathroom and my one year old son started potty training right away. It's got a comfortable place to rest his feet, and a plush seat that is easy to sit on and not fall through. Also the handles are great. Glad I got this. Better than a typical kids' training potty!
customer_reviews.author: Sarafina Donald

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Love this!! This was recommended to me by my sister in law and I'm happy we bought it. It's easy to clean and I dont worry about my 3 year old falling off as it's very stable. I would highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Blessedwith4

customer_reviews.title: Unstable and dangerous
customer_reviews.text: This product is unstable, cheap, and dangerous! The seat does not fit securely in my elongated toilet and slides around. The ladder is extremely wobbly. My 3 year old tipped over trying to get on it the first (and last) time. She would have been injured had I not been standing right next to her. The seat also has a foul odor. I am immediately returning it.
customer_reviews.author: ED

customer_reviews.title: Seat is easy to clean My daughter can get herself up and ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Seat is easy to clean My daughter can get herself up and down on her own It's easy to set up and remove so the toilet can be shared between kids and adults Cons: It's a bit shaky so I still need to supervise more than I'd like to The grooves on the step collect dirt and grime and are a pain to clean. I get that there needs to be something there to keep little feet from slipping, but I'd rather have something with bumps or a rubbery texture rather than deep grooves.
customer_reviews.author: squirrelly

customer_reviews.title: Pee everywhere. But I don't have to touch poop anymore!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to stop cleaning disgusting poops out of the training potty. Independence has been gained! Hooray! But the seam on the seat is perfect for collecting my son's urine. It makes a mess, and the bathroom smells so bad. But, lesser of 2 evils, it was better than dumping and wiping out poo from the potty. Never had issues with the 27lb 3 yo falling or the ladder failing. We have found that a stepping stool and a special toilet seat works better with less mess.
customer_reviews.author: teachermomsciencelady

customer_reviews.title: Really made potty training easy
customer_reviews.text: Love this seat. Easy for my toddler to climb up and down and uses the big potty so you don't have to empty any gross business. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that she frequently doesn't get back far enough and pees under the rim of the seat so a lot of cleaning. I bought another potty chair that sits on top of the big potty from another manufacturer. It doesn't have the stair which I miss - but it has a splash guard in the front which works wonders for boys AND girls!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. My husband and I have been trying to potty train my son for months, but he HATED using the potty seat that just fits over the toilet. I don't know if it's because the seat was too hard or he hated trying to get on and off (sometimes we had to lift him up and down). He has been so much better with this one. The seat is cushioned, and it's easy enough to set it up that he does it himself whenever he needs to go. He's still not completely potty trained, but I believe this has helped so much. I'm so glad I decided to buy this!
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, poor execution
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this, but it is so unstable by 2 year old can't climb up it himself without tipping it- so I help which starts the 'I do it myself' fight. Plus the raised part is high enough his pee goes under it and out- not a problem for girls but a definite problem for boys. Also the seat is hard to get in and out of because of how its positioned- he has to be lifted into it. And like I said, he wants to use it so bad I actually had to hide it! A few adjustments and it could be a great product
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: I was pleasantly surprised that it does fit and it easily sits on other toilets in our house as well
customer_reviews.text: Our 20 month old daughter loves this potty seat. We have a tall toilet with a strange shaped seat in her bathroom. I was worried it wouldn't fit, I was pleasantly surprised that it does fit and it easily sits on other toilets in our house as well. My daughter loves the seat, it makes her feel secure that she will not fall in. She happily agrees to use the toilet 3-5 times a day as we are just starting to introduce the idea. I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Teach

customer_reviews.title: Durable and easy to use/store and clean.
customer_reviews.text: My grandson has been "practicing" with this for over a year, but got serious a few months ago. This product has held up to him putting it in place and then putting it away every day. I recommend supervising for a while to make sure there are no balance or slipping issues. He is confident with this product and now enjoys getting the kitchen step stool out to show that he can get into the refrigerator. Not sure if that's a good thing. It's a gateway product to a kitchen step stool and, who knows, step ladders next?
customer_reviews.author: Elise C

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but the item is really wobbly
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, but the item is really wobbly. My son actually became afraid of using the toilet because it wobbled so much. I think it's an awesome idea, but poorly executed. The seat itself was very cushy and comfortable though, but I had to pick him up and stand next to him while he used it because it was so unsafe...which totally defeats the purpose of buying it. We went back to the regular potty seat without the ladder. I was really sad that this item didn't work well. If it had been better constructed it would have been amazing and given my son a lot of independence while potty training and using the potty.
customer_reviews.author: Manny M.

customer_reviews.title: Overall, a good product...
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings about this seat. It's easy to use for my 3 yr son & he feels like a big boy using it, but things get really messy. I feel like there should be some sort of splash guard that can be attached if need be. Pee gets everywhere and I've checked to see how this is happening--my son isn't sitting weird. It's just the gaps between this seat & the toilet seat and how everything will splash against the front. So, I wonder how many other parents of boys have had this issue. Overall, I would still recommend based on how much more my son prefers this to his smaller seat.
customer_reviews.author: M.H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for some time now, and our child loves it. She can even put it on the toilet by herself, if she's in the mood lol. With another child learning to use the potty soon, I'm glad we don't need to buy another one. Cleans easily and also folds up fairly flat to travel with. I see no reason not to get it. If we had a bigger house, we would get more for each bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wells

customer_reviews.title: it is great. And a lot cleaner
customer_reviews.text: Daughter loves it now. It took a little getting use to the idea. Couple of thoughts. It is a little unstable for them to get up and down by themselves. Also, kids will need to remove clothing to get up on the step. A little scary for them to stand on the step to pull down pants. Other than those 2 things, it is great. And a lot cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: LuckyDuck

customer_reviews.title: Easy for my toddler to use herself
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5-yo is able to set this up on the toilet and climb on entirely by herself now, which is convenient for us. We did have to help her a lot at first, but she grew more comfortable and confident. She is not good about lifting the toilet seat first, though, and I can feel little scratches developing on the seat because of this sitting on top of it. Occasionally the steps flip up when she leans on the handles, which can be disconcerting. But it pretty much fills the role I wanted it to!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Bley

customer_reviews.title: The only thing I really don't like about this is that there's no guard for little ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to give my son a chance to work on potty training more independently. He's 3 and autistic and doesn't have any interest in learning. I thought maybe if he could do it himself, he'd be more willing. Doesn't seem to be the case. The only thing I really don't like about this is that there's no guard for little boys to prevent messes. The seat itself seems very comfortable. This seat appears to fit better on smaller toilet bowls. It won't sit right if the toilet is too large (had that issue on vacation.) It's not a bad product at all, it just doesn't work that well for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Stefany H.

customer_reviews.title: The seat is cushioned and comfortable, easy to clean and the whole mechanism is ...
customer_reviews.text: The seat is cushioned and comfortable, easy to clean and the whole mechanism is easy to remove and store. However, it still slides around the toilet seat when my son tries to sit down. And when he tries to do it himself, he almost fell in the toilet. When he uses the handles on the side to shift his weight more to the back, the seat wants to collapse on him. This is the third type of toilet seat/potty training seat I've tried, and so far, not much has worked with regards to safety and encouraging independence.
customer_reviews.author: Stella W.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money, very flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: This would be good if it actually worked! It’s very flimsy and not safe for children trying to use the bathroom. Everytime my son would use this he would make a mess because the seat would not stay down. Don’t waste your money and Get a better quality seat.
customer_reviews.author: Theheartfulmama

customer_reviews.title: Love Love this seat!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this seat and recommend it to anyone not interested in dumping excrament from a little potty. My son is 3.5 and still uses this seat every day and has been using it since 18 months. I credit this to his eagerness to potty train early too. He loved using the same potty as his mommy used. It easily folds and stores between my sink and toilet if an adult wanted to use his bathroom. The seat is comfortable and I've never had a problem with not having a urine cup on the top. He knows to alway push it down to go. We have one at Grandmas too!
customer_reviews.author: Denver mommy

customer_reviews.title: The perfect potty seat
customer_reviews.text: This finally made my son feel secure enough to sit on the toilet. We tried a few seats and step stool but he always hated it for some reason. The slightly soft seat, handles and step for his feet were just right. Wish I had tried this first!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome potty chair
customer_reviews.text: Awesome potty chair. My 2 1/2 year old son can climb up on is own and the handles are great for extra support. I only wish there was abit more "boy " protection in the front to keep him form getting pee over the top but I find if I sit him back further that helps alot. It was very easy to assemble and saves space by neatly folding in half for convenient storage
customer_reviews.author: Ann C. Hunwick

customer_reviews.title: Great seat! A must have for potty training.
customer_reviews.text: Now that we've been using this seat for a few months I'm ready to give a great review. My toddler who just turned three loves this seat. She can get up and down all by herself. Even my one year old can sit on this seat. This seat goes on top of the toilet seat perfectly. Other reviews seem to think the toilet seat should be up, but the seat needs to be down for this seat to fit over. I'm so happy with this purchase and the price is great! Way better than having a little potty to clean out, eww. This seat and Lysol wipes in the bathroom make potty training way easier.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: This potty seat is wonderful! It allows my son to be much more ...
customer_reviews.text: This potty seat is wonderful! It allows my son to be much more independent using the bathroom. We've had it for a year and it's still going strong. It fits well on our toilet. The only reason for four stars is because the holes on the sides (used to adjust the height of the seat) are the perfect size for a toddler to get his finger stuck, which my son did. It was painful and scary for him. This is a design flaw that could easily be fixed by the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: HappyGibb

customer_reviews.title: Terrible terrible product
customer_reviews.text: Terrible terrible product, a waist of money! The whole thing is unstable, my 2.5 yo son is afraid to climb it because it shakes all the time, and has not stability in the floor due to the rounded legs. The support of the ladder is weak,and it keeps sliding on the floor as my son tries to climb. T looks too dangerous to use, now I am just stuck with this bad product.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Best toddler potty
customer_reviews.text: My toddler loves it, he is officially potty trained within a few days. This seat made it non intimidating for him. He thought it was fun to go up and down the steps. Very sturdy and sooo easy to remove and put back on. Easy to clean. The steps get grimy after a while and because they have raised ridges you cant just wipe them you need a brush, but really not a big deal. So happy I got this vs the mini toilets you see everywhere that I would have to empty out not with this, just flush. Easy.
customer_reviews.author: BVM

customer_reviews.title: This step/seat combo is perfect! He can use the handles to position himself ...
customer_reviews.text: We had initially ordered a separate seat and stool for our toilet. The seat slid around while our son sat on it, and the stool wasn't high enough for him to be able to sit on the toilet without having to climb and put his hands all over the toilet seat. This step/seat combo is perfect! He can use the handles to position himself on the seat. Bonus points for the easy fold for visitors that need to use the same toilet.
customer_reviews.author: cobooth

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: This potty seat is perfect! Our daughter has been resistant to potty train and has not taken to the other seats we’ve purchased. But this one was the game changer! We unboxed it, she stepped right up and went on the potty! Now, we are still training but I can say this potty seat took her stress away. We highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Krista P. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great product and if you don't have a raised toilet ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves that this allows her the freedom to use the adult toilet. The only reason I didn't give it a five star is I wish the hand rails were a little higher. It was OK on lowest setting but when we had to raise it to fit a raised toilet there was really no handle sticking up above the toilet seat and my daughter is not as secure going on her own. It gets a little precarious at turning around at the top without the handles sticking up above the seat. Great product and if you don't have a raised toilet seat just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible for BOYS
customer_reviews.text: Terrible for BOYS!! The pee WILL leak through either the top (no splash guard) or through the gap because this seat does not sit flush with the toilet seat. I think girls wouldn't have an issue, but if you have a little boy in training, don't waste your time or money. Also, for beginning potty trainees, this seat is not the softest so it doesn't seem comfortable for a 35 pound kids to sit on for more than 5mins.
customer_reviews.author: ShakeitJadie

customer_reviews.title: Daughter likes it because it makers her feel like a big girl
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 2 year old daughter who was in the process of potty training. We have one of those miniature toilet potties in the living room and also keep this one against the wall in our bathroom. She usually uses this one because she like using the "big potty". She has got to the point now that when it's time to use the potty she goes into the bathroom, pulls this from the corner and puts it on the toilet her self.
customer_reviews.author: DC5Campos

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves climbing onto it and being able to sit on the big toilet. It’s a great item to have around when transitioning the kiddos to toilet training! The handles on the sides are perfect for him to get on and off all by himself, which creates independence (which he craves!).
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Haddad

customer_reviews.title: Get this, not the other stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Our 2 year old is able to move it from the wall, put it on the stool, and get herself up to sit down. She then puts it away back against the wall shen she's done. I'm glad I took a chance ordering this little step. Would definitely buy again and tell anyone to just go with this, instead of just a seat cover that slides around and a separate step.
customer_reviews.author: girlwon1

customer_reviews.title: Pee Puddles
customer_reviews.text: The use and the handles are fine. But the seat is too small I think or something. I have a boy and since the seat is too small, pee gets wicked by the under side of the seat so it is ALL over the regular toilet seat when you remove it. Plus it's still on the potty chair seat so it drips all over the floor. I had to get a plastic mat to put under it to make the pee puddles easier to clean.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: but I am glad we took a chance
customer_reviews.text: We were sceptical before buying, but I am glad we took a chance. This worked great and we highly recommend it. We have an elongated toilet seat and it remained solid and firm and without an problems - no slipping or moving around. It was easy to use, put together and it works perfect for my 2 year old and 4 year old. Seems comfortable and we've had it now for quite sometime and there is absolutely no wear and tear on it - easy to clean and has held up, even looking like new now after about a year.
customer_reviews.author: Donald A. Prentiss

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, but not as happy with it as ...
customer_reviews.text: Great concept, but not as happy with it as I thought I would be. There isn't a splash guard, just more of a raised up area that does not help little boys. Also, when you pick it up to move it watch out because usually there is urine all underneath it. Wish I would've just bought a potty seat and step stool.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs L

customer_reviews.title: ... 21 months he climbed up to poop which was amazing. He would come get me to flush
customer_reviews.text: I got this when my son was 21 months he climbed up to poop which was amazing. He would come get me to flush, wipe his butt, then give him a hot wheel car. Now if only he woukd climb up to pee! I did have to buy ankle weights bc the bottom wasn't very steady when he would try to turn around. It was 2 pound weights on each leg and that held it down well enough for my son (28 pounds).
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Lynch Swaggerty

customer_reviews.title: Working As Hoped
customer_reviews.text: Assembles easily. Fit standard toilet. Non-slip. Little guy thought it was cool, could climb up without a problem. Happy as a king on his throne. Seems like this is going to be handy and worth the cost and trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Pop Bop

customer_reviews.title: Cushie tushie!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a fantastic potty training tool. It's easy, light, and my son feels confident using it. Being that it's light, and very mobile, when it is on the potty it's not super firm, meaning it does move a little. However, when used appropriately, step up, sit down, step down, it's totally fantastic. He can now use the big potty by himself, no need for me to clean up the little bowl, he can happily flush away. My bigger kids have zero issues moving it and putting it back. It's been a great addition to our bathroom during this toddler training time. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Melaina Lara

customer_reviews.title: It was really easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: It was really easy to assemble. My son thought it was fun to climb the ladder for the first couple times, until the novelty wore off. It's nice because you don't need a seat and step stool. We have both this ladder one and just a seat kind. They are both just as good. This one is a little harder to clean, but it has lasted. We've been using it for about a year and my son still likes it and nothing has broken.
customer_reviews.author: Spchlk

product_meta.title: Mommy's Helper Contoured Cushie Step Up, 1 Count
product_meta.description:
Size:Original versionMommys Helper Contoured Cushie Step Up Padded Potty Seat with Step Stool is the perfect potty training tool! This ergonomically thickly cushioned contoured seat with built in deflector and specially molded non slip handles provide the ultimate comfort for child. After use simple fold for compact storage between uses.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
A comfortably padded potty seat with a built in fold-up non-slip step stool from Mommy's Helper. It is thickly cushioned for comfort and confidence. This designed to allow you to fold up and store most anywhere between uses. It has extra soft non-slip handles for comfort and extra wide non-slip floor pads for security. This is easy assembly no tools required and fit standard and most elongated toilet seats.
feature_bullets: Tip: Potty Seat can be placed on top of the existing toilet seat OR the toilet rim depending on height and opening of toilet in order to provide maximum stability.Easy assembly no tools required
Fits toilets ranging in height from 16” to 18.5” from floor to toilet bowl seat.Folds for easy storage
Extra wide non slip floor pads.Seat measures 13.5” from front to back and 11.75” from side to side.
Non slip handles.Opening measures 7” from front to back and 5.65” from side to side.
Fits standard and most elongated toilet seats
NOTE: Kindly refer the instructional video and above mentioned measurements for size/fit related queries
